content.question: Which of the following is an accurate comparison of the two sourcesâ€™ arguments?

choices.label: The medical examiners want the state to legislate on behalf of the workers, while Smiles does not want the state to intervene in labor relations.
The medical examiners do not want the state to legislate on behalf of the workers, while Smiles wants the state to intervene on their behalf.
The medical examiners and Smiles both want the state to intervene on behalf of the workers.
Neither the medical examiners nor Smiles want the state to intervene on behalf of the workers.

content.answer: The medical examiners want the state to legislate on behalf of the workers, while Smiles does not want the state to intervene in labor relations.

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Compare the arguments or main ideas of two sources.
